I am covered with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I gloat in triumph over those who tried to ambush me;
I hear the defeated cries of the evil foes who attacked me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly grow like a palm tree;
they grow high like a cedar in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Planted in the Lord’s house,
they grow in the courts of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They bear fruit even when they are old;
they are filled with vitality and have many leaves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they proclaim that the Lord, my Protector,
is just and never unfair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord reigns.
He is robed in majesty.
The Lord is robed;
he wears strength around his waist.
Indeed, the world is established; it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne has been secure from ancient times;
you have always been king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The waves roar, O Lord,
the waves roar,
the waves roar and crash.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Above the sound of the surging water,
and the mighty waves of the sea,
the Lord sits enthroned in majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rules you set down are completely reliable.
Holiness aptly adorns your house, O Lord, forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, the God who avenges!
O God who avenges, reveal your splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up, O judge of the earth.
Pay back the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how long will the wicked,
how long will the wicked celebrate?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They spew out threats and speak defiantly;
all the evildoers boast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, they crush your people;
they oppress the nation that belongs to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They kill the widow and the resident foreigner,
and they murder the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they say, “The Lord does not see this;
the God of Jacob does not take notice of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take notice of this, you ignorant people.
You fools, when will you ever understand?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does the one who makes the human ear not hear?
Does the one who forms the human eye not see?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does the one who disciplines the nations not punish?
He is the one who imparts knowledge to human beings!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows that peoples’ thoughts
are morally bankrupt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is the one whom you instruct, O Lord,
the one whom you teach from your law,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order to protect him from times of trouble,
until the wicked are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly the Lord does not forsake his people;
he does not abandon the nation that belongs to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For justice will prevail,
and all the morally upright will be vindicated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will rise up to defend me against the wicked?
Who will stand up for me against the evildoers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the Lord had not helped me,
I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I say, “My foot is slipping,”
your loyal love, O Lord, supports me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When worries threaten to overwhelm me,
your soothing touch makes me happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cruel rulers are not your allies,
those who make oppressive laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They conspire against the blameless,
and condemn to death the innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord will protect me,
and my God will shelter me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Come, let us sing for joy to the Lord.
Let us shout out praises to our Protector who delivers us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us enter his presence with thanksgiving.
Let us shout out to him in celebration.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is a great God,
a great king who is superior to all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The depths of the earth are in his hand,
and the mountain peaks belong to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea is his, for he made it.
His hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let us bow down and worship.
Let us kneel before the Lord, our Creator.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he is our God;
we are the people of his pasture,
the sheep he owns.
Today, if only you would obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says, “Do not be stubborn like they were at Meribah,
like they were that day at Massah in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
where your ancestors challenged my authority,
and tried my patience, even though they had seen my work.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So I made a vow in my anger,
‘They will never enter into the resting place I had set aside for them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord a new song.
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord. Praise his name.
Announce every day how he delivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell the nations about his splendor.
Tell all the nations about his amazing deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is great and certainly worthy of praise;
he is more awesome than all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the nations are worthless,
but the Lord made the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Majestic splendor emanates from him;
his sanctuary is firmly established and beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the nations,
ascribe to the Lord splendor and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord the splendor he deserves.
Bring an offering and enter his courts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord in holy attire.
Tremble before him, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say among the nations, “The Lord reigns!
The world is established; it cannot be moved.
He judges the nations fairly.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sky rejoice, and the earth be happy.
Let the sea and everything in it shout.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the fields and everything in them celebrate.
Then let the trees of the forest shout with joy
speaker: Narrator

text:
before the Lord, for he comes.
For he comes to judge the earth.
He judges the world fairly,
and the nations in accordance with his justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord reigns.
Let the earth be happy.
Let the many coastlands rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Dark clouds surround him;
equity and justice are the foundation of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire goes before him;
on every side it burns up his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His lightning bolts light up the world;
the earth sees and trembles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,
before the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sky declares his justice,
and all the nations see his splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who worship idols are ashamed,
those who boast about worthless idols.
All the gods bow down before him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zion hears and rejoices,
the towns of Judah are happy,
because of your judgments, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, O Lord, are the Most High over the whole earth;
you are elevated high above all gods.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The godly bask in the light;
the morally upright experience joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You godly ones, rejoice in the Lord.
Give thanks to his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord a new song,
for he performs amazing deeds.
His right hand and his mighty arm
accomplish deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord demonstrates his power to deliver;
in the sight of the nations he reveals his justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remains loyal and faithful to the family of Israel.
All the ends of the earth see our God deliver us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout out praises to the Lord, all the earth.
Break out in a joyful shout and sing!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord accompanied by a harp,
accompanied by a harp and the sound of music.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With trumpets and the blaring of the ram’s horn,
shout out praises before the king, the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea and everything in it shout,
along with the world and those who live in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the rivers clap their hands!
Let the mountains sing in unison
speaker: Narrator

text:
before the Lord.
For he comes to judge the earth.
He judges the world fairly,
and the nations in a just manner.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord reigns!
The nations tremble.
He sits enthroned above the cherubim;
the earth shakes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is elevated in Zion;
he is exalted over all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise your great and awesome name.
He is holy!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord our God.
Worship before his footstool.
He is holy!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He spoke to them from a pillar of cloud;
they obeyed his regulations and the ordinance he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord our God, you answered them.
They found you to be a forgiving God,
but also one who punished their sinful deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord our God!
Worship on his holy hill,
for the Lord our God is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout out praises to the Lord, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord with joy.
Enter his presence with joyful singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Acknowledge that the Lord is God.
He made us and we belong to him,
we are his people, the sheep of his pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving,
and his courts with praise.
Give him thanks.
Praise his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is good.
His loyal love endures,
and he is faithful through all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing about loyalty and justice.
To you, O Lord, I will sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will walk in the way of integrity.
When will you come to me?
I will conduct my business with integrity in the midst of my palace.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will have nothing to do with a perverse person;
I will not permit evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will destroy anyone who slanders his neighbor in secret.
I will not tolerate anyone who has a haughty demeanor and an arrogant attitude.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will favor the honest people of the land,
and allow them to live with me.
Those who walk in the way of integrity will attend me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deceitful people will not live in my palace.
Liars will not be welcome in my presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each morning I will destroy all the wicked people in the land,
and remove all evildoers from the city of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, hear my prayer.
Pay attention to my cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not ignore me in my time of trouble.
Listen to me.
When I call out to you, quickly answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my days go up in smoke,
and my bones are charred as in a fireplace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is parched and withered like grass,
for I am unable to eat food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the anxiety that makes me groan,
my bones protrude from my skin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am like an owl in the wilderness;
I am like a screech owl among the ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I stay awake;
I am like a solitary bird on a roof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my enemies taunt me;
those who mock me use my name in their curses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I eat ashes as if they were bread,
and mix my drink with my tears,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of your anger and raging fury.
Indeed, you pick me up and throw me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My days are coming to an end,
and I am withered like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, rule forever,
and your reputation endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will rise up and have compassion on Zion.
For it is time to have mercy on her,
for the appointed time has come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, your servants take delight in her stones,
and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations will respect the reputation of the Lord,
and all the kings of the earth will respect his splendor,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when the Lord rebuilds Zion,
and reveals his splendor,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when he responds to the prayer of the destitute,
and does not reject their request.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The account of his intervention will be recorded for future generations;
people yet to be born will praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will look down from his sanctuary above;
from heaven the Lord will look toward earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order to hear the painful cries of the prisoners,
and to set free those condemned to die,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so they may proclaim the name of the Lord in Zion,
and praise him in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when the nations gather together,
and the kingdoms pay tribute to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has taken away my strength in the middle of life;
he has cut short my days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I say, “O my God, please do not take me away in the middle of my life.
You endure through all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In earlier times you established the earth;
the skies are your handiwork.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will perish,
but you will endure.
They will wear out like a garment;
like clothes you will remove them and they will disappear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you remain;
your years do not come to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of your servants will settle down here,
and their descendants will live securely in your presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, O my soul.
With all that is within me, praise his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, O my soul.
Do not forget all his kind deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who forgives all your sins,
who heals all your diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who delivers your life from the Pit,
who crowns you with his loyal love and compassion,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who satisfies your life with good things,
so your youth is renewed like an eagle’s.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord does what is fair,
and executes justice for all the oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord revealed his faithful acts to Moses,
his deeds to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is compassionate and merciful;
he is patient and demonstrates great loyal love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does not always accuse,
and does not stay angry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does not deal with us as our sins deserve;
he does not repay us as our misdeeds deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the skies are high above the earth,
so his loyal love towers over his faithful followers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As far as the eastern horizon is from the west,
so he removes the guilt of our rebellious actions from us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a father has compassion on his children,
so the Lord has compassion on his faithful followers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he knows what we are made of;
he realizes we are made of clay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person’s life is like grass.
Like a flower in the field it flourishes,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but when the hot wind blows, it disappears,
and one can no longer even spot the place where it once grew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord continually shows loyal love to his faithful followers,
and is faithful to their descendants,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to those who keep his covenant,
who are careful to obey his commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has established his throne in heaven;
his kingdom extends over everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, you angels of his,
you powerful warriors who carry out his decrees
and obey his orders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all you warriors of his,
you servants of his who carry out his desires.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all that he has made,
in all the regions of his kingdom.
Praise the Lord, O my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, O my soul!
O Lord my God, you are magnificent.
You are robed in splendor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He covers himself with light as if it were a garment.
He stretches out the skies like a tent curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and lays the beams of the upper rooms of his palace on the rain clouds.
He makes the clouds his chariot,
and travels on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes the winds his messengers,
and the flaming fire his attendant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He established the earth on its foundations;
it will never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The watery deep covered it like a garment;
the waters reached above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your shout made the waters retreat;
at the sound of your thunderous voice they hurried off—
speaker: Narrator

text:
as the mountains rose up,
and the valleys went down—
to the place you appointed for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You set up a boundary for them that they could not cross,
so that they would not cover the earth again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns springs into streams;
they flow between the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They provide water for all the animals in the field;
the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The birds of the sky live beside them;
they chirp among the bushes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He waters the mountains from the upper rooms of his palace;
the earth is full of the fruit you cause to grow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He provides grass for the cattle,
and crops for people to cultivate,
so they can produce food from the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text:
as well as wine that makes people glad,
and olive oil to make their faces shine,
as well as bread that sustains them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The trees of the Lord receive all the rain they need,
the cedars of Lebanon that he planted,
speaker: Narrator

text:
where the birds make nests,
near the evergreens in which the herons live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wild goats live in the high mountains;
the rock badgers find safety in the cliffs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made the moon to mark the months,
and the sun sets according to a regular schedule.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make it dark and night comes,
during which all the beasts of the forest prowl around.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lions roar for prey,
seeking their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the sun rises, they withdraw
and sleep in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
People then go out to do their work,
and they labor until evening.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Over here is the deep, wide sea,
which teems with innumerable swimming creatures,
living things both small and large.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ships travel there,
and over here swims the whale you made to play in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your creatures wait for you
to provide them with food on a regular basis.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give food to them and they receive it;
you open your hand and they are filled with food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you ignore them, they panic.
When you take away their life’s breath,
they die and return to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you send your life-giving breath, they are created,
and you replenish the surface of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the splendor of the Lord endure.
May the Lord find pleasure in the living things he has made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He looks down on the earth and it shakes;
he touches the mountains and they start to smolder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
I will sing praise to my God as long as I exist.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my thoughts be pleasing to him.
I will rejoice in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May sinners disappear from the earth,
and the wicked vanish.
Praise the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord.
Call on his name.
Make known his accomplishments among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him.
Make music to him.
Tell about all his miraculous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Boast about his holy name.
Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and the strength he gives.
Seek his presence continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Recall the miraculous deeds he performed,
his mighty acts and the judgments he decreed,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O children of Abraham, God’s servant,
you descendants of Jacob, God’s chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
he carries out judgment throughout the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He always remembers his covenantal decree,
the promise he made to a thousand generations—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the promise he made to Abraham,
the promise he made by oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave it to Jacob as a decree,
to Israel as a lasting promise,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
as the portion of your inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were few in number,
just a very few, and resident foreigners within it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
they wandered from nation to nation,
and from one kingdom to another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He let no one oppress them;
he disciplined kings for their sake,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “Don’t touch my chosen ones.
Don’t harm my prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He called down a famine upon the earth;
he cut off all the food supply.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent a man ahead of them—
Joseph was sold as a servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The shackles hurt his feet;
his neck was placed in an iron collar,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until the time when his prediction came true.
The Lord’s word proved him right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king authorized his release;
the ruler of nations set him free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He put him in charge of his palace,
and made him manager of all his property,
speaker: Narrator

text:
giving him authority to imprison his officials
and to teach his advisers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel moved to Egypt;
Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord made his people very fruitful,
and made them more numerous than their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He caused the Egyptians to hate his people,
and to mistreat his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent his servant Moses,
and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They executed his miraculous signs among them,
and his amazing deeds in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made it dark;
Moses and Aaron did not disobey his orders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned the Egyptians’ water into blood,
and killed their fish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their land was overrun by frogs,
which even got into the rooms of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He ordered flies to come;
gnats invaded their whole territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent hail along with the rain;
there was lightning in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He destroyed their vines and fig trees,
and broke the trees throughout their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He ordered locusts to come,
innumerable grasshoppers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They ate all the vegetation in their land,
and devoured the crops of their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down all the firstborn in their land,
the firstfruits of their reproductive power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought his people out enriched with silver and gold;
none of his tribes stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt was happy when they left,
for they were afraid of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread out a cloud for a cover,
and provided a fire to light up the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked for food, and he sent quail;
he satisfied them with food from the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He opened up a rock and water flowed out;
a river ran through dry regions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, he remembered the sacred promise
he made to Abraham his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he led his people out, they rejoiced;
his chosen ones shouted with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He handed the territory of nations over to them,
and they took possession of what other peoples had produced,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that they might keep his commands
and obey his laws.
Praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord.
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
and his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can adequately recount the Lord’s mighty acts,
or relate all his praiseworthy deeds?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those who promote justice,
and do what is right all the time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, O Lord, when you show favor to your people.
Pay attention to me, when you deliver,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so I may see the prosperity of your chosen ones,
rejoice along with your nation,
and boast along with the people who belong to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have sinned like our ancestors;
we have done wrong, we have done evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our ancestors in Egypt failed to appreciate your miraculous deeds.
They failed to remember your many acts of loyal love,
and they rebelled at the sea, by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he delivered them for the sake of his reputation,
that he might reveal his power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shouted at the Red Sea and it dried up;
he led them through the deep water as if it were a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He delivered them from the power of the one who hated them,
and rescued them from the power of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The water covered their enemies;
not even one of them survived.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They believed his promises;
they sang praises to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They quickly forgot what he had done;
they did not wait for his instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the wilderness they had an insatiable craving for meat;
they challenged God in the wastelands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He granted their request,
then struck them with a disease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the camp they resented Moses,
and Aaron, the Lord’s holy priest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan;
it engulfed the group led by Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire burned their group;
the flames scorched the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made an image of a calf at Horeb,
and worshiped a metal idol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They traded their majestic God
for the image of an ox that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They rejected the God who delivered them,
the one who performed great deeds in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text:
amazing feats in the land of Ham,
mighty acts by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He threatened to destroy them,
but Moses, his chosen one, interceded with him
and turned back his destructive anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They rejected the fruitful land;
they did not believe his promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They grumbled in their tents;
they did not obey the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he made a solemn vow
that he would make them die in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
make their descendants die among the nations,
and scatter them among foreign lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They worshiped Baal of Peor,
and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made the Lord angry by their actions,
and a plague broke out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Phinehas took a stand and intervened,
and the plague subsided.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was credited to Phinehas as a righteous act
for all generations to come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made him angry by the waters of Meribah,
and Moses suffered because of them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they aroused his temper,
and he spoke rashly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not destroy the nations,
as the Lord had commanded them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They mixed in with the nations
and learned their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They worshiped their idols,
which became a snare to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shed innocent blood—
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan.
The land was polluted by bloodshed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They were defiled by their deeds,
and unfaithful in their actions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the Lord was angry with his people
and despised the people who belonged to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He handed them over to the nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their enemies oppressed them;
they were subject to their authority.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many times he delivered them,
but they had a rebellious attitude,
and degraded themselves by their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he took notice of their distress,
when he heard their cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered his covenant with them,
and relented because of his great loyal love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He caused all their conquerors
to have pity on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver us, O Lord, our God.
Gather us from among the nations.
Then we will give thanks to your holy name,
and boast about your praiseworthy deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God of Israel deserves praise,
in the future and forevermore.
Let all the people say, “We agree! Praise the Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
and his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those delivered by the Lord speak out,
those whom he delivered from the power of the enemy,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They wandered through the wilderness, in a wasteland;
they found no road to a city in which to live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They were hungry and thirsty;
they fainted from exhaustion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out to the Lord in their distress;
he delivered them from their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them on a level road,
that they might find a city in which to live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his loyal love,
and for the amazing things he has done for people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has satisfied those who thirst,
and those who hunger he has filled with food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sat in utter darkness,
bound in painful iron chains,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because they had rebelled against God’s commands,
and rejected the instructions of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he used suffering to humble them;
they stumbled and no one helped them up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out to the Lord in their distress;
he delivered them from their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them out of the utter darkness,
and tore off their shackles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his loyal love,
and for the amazing things he has done for people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he shattered the bronze gates,
and hacked through the iron bars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They acted like fools in their rebellious ways,
and suffered because of their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They lost their appetite for all food,
and they drew near the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out to the Lord in their distress;
he delivered them from their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent them an assuring word and healed them;
he rescued them from the pits where they were trapped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his loyal love,
and for the amazing things he has done for people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them present thank offerings,
and loudly proclaim what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some traveled on the sea in ships,
and carried cargo over the vast waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They witnessed the acts of the Lord,
his amazing feats on the deep water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave the order for a windstorm,
and it stirred up the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They reached up to the sky,
then dropped into the depths.
The sailors’ strength left them because the danger was so great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They swayed and staggered like drunks,
and all their skill proved ineffective.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out to the Lord in their distress;
he delivered them from their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He calmed the storm,
and the waves grew silent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sailors rejoiced because the waves grew quiet,
and he led them to the harbor they desired.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his loyal love,
and for the amazing things he has done for people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people.
Let them praise him in the place where the leaders preside.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned streams into a desert,
springs of water into arid land,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and a fruitful land into a barren place,
because of the sin of its inhabitants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for his people, he turned a desert into a pool of water,
and a dry land into springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He allowed the hungry to settle there,
and they established a city in which to live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cultivated fields,
and planted vineyards,
which yielded a harvest of fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He blessed them so that they became very numerous.
He would not allow their cattle to decrease in number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for their enemies, they decreased in number and were beaten down,
because of painful distress and suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He would pour contempt upon princes,
and he made them wander in a wasteland with no road.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he protected the needy from oppression,
and cared for his families like a flock of sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the godly see this, they rejoice,
and every sinner shuts his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever is wise, let him take note of these things.
Let them consider the Lord’s acts of loyal love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am determined, O God.
I will sing and praise you with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, O stringed instrument and harp.
I will wake up at dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks before the nations, O Lord.
I will sing praises to you before foreigners.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your loyal love extends beyond the sky,
and your faithfulness reaches the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up above the sky, O God.
May your splendor cover the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver by your power and answer me,
so that the ones you love may be safe.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Gilead belongs to me,
as does Manasseh.
Ephraim is my helmet,
Judah my royal scepter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moab is my washbasin.
I will make Edom serve me.
I will shout in triumph over Philistia.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will lead me into the fortified city?
Who will bring me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not rejected us, O God?
O God, you do not go into battle with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give us help against the enemy,
for any help men might offer is futile.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By God’s power we will conquer;
he will trample down our enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God whom I praise, do not ignore me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they say cruel and deceptive things to me;
they lie to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surround me and say hateful things;
they attack me for no reason.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay my love with accusations,
but I continue to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay me evil for good,
and hate for love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Appoint an evil man to testify against him.
May an accuser stand at his right side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he is judged, he will be found guilty.
Then his prayer will be regarded as sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his days be few.
May another take his job.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children be fatherless,
and his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children roam around begging,
asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the creditor seize all he owns.
May strangers loot his property.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May no one show him kindness.
May no one have compassion on his fatherless children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his descendants be cut off.
May the memory of them be wiped out by the time the next generation arrives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his ancestors’ sins be remembered by the Lord.
May his mother’s sin not be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord be constantly aware of them,
and cut off the memory of his children from the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He loved to curse others, so those curses have come upon him.
He had no desire to bless anyone, so he has experienced no blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made cursing a way of life,
so curses poured into his stomach like water
and seeped into his bones like oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May a curse attach itself to him, like a garment one puts on,
or a belt one wears continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord repay my accusers in this way,
those who say evil things about me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Sovereign Lord,
intervene on my behalf for the sake of your reputation.
Because your loyal love is good, deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am oppressed and needy,
and my heart beats violently within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am fading away like a shadow at the end of the day;
I am shaken off like a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am so starved my knees shake;
I have turned into skin and bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am disdained by them.
When they see me, they shake their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me, O Lord my God.
Because you are faithful to me, deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they will realize this is your work,
and that you, Lord, have accomplished it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They curse, but you will bless.
When they attack, they will be humiliated,
but your servant will rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My accusers will be covered with shame,
and draped in humiliation as if it were a robe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank the Lord profusely.
In the middle of a crowd I will praise him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because he stands at the right hand of the needy,
to deliver him from those who threaten his life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here is the Lord’s proclamation to my lord:
“Sit down at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord extends your dominion from Zion.
Rule in the midst of your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your people willingly follow you when you go into battle.
On the holy hills at sunrise the dew of your youth belongs to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord makes this promise on oath and will not revoke it:
“You are an eternal priest after the pattern of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, at your right hand
he strikes down kings in the day he unleashes his anger.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
From the stream along the road he drinks;
then he lifts up his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart,
in the assembly of the godly and the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s deeds are great,
eagerly awaited by all who desire them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His work is majestic and glorious,
and his faithfulness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does amazing things that will be remembered;
the Lord is merciful and compassionate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives food to his faithful followers;
he always remembers his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He announced that he would do mighty deeds for his people,
giving them a land that belonged to other nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His acts are characterized by faithfulness and justice;
all his precepts are reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are forever firm,
and should be faithfully and properly carried out.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
How blessed is the one who obeys the Lord,
who takes great delight in keeping his commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His descendants will be powerful on the earth;
the godly will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His house contains wealth and riches;
his integrity endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the darkness a light shines for the godly,
for each one who is merciful, compassionate, and just.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It goes well for the one who generously lends money,
and conducts his business honestly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will never be shaken;
others will always remember one who is just.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does not fear bad news.
He is confident; he trusts in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His resolve is firm; he will not succumb to fear
before he looks in triumph on his enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord.
Praise, you servants of the Lord,
praise the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord’s name be praised
now and forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From east to west
the Lord’s name is deserving of praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is exalted over all the nations;
his splendor reaches beyond the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can compare to the Lord our God,
who sits on a high throne?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He bends down to look
at the sky and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He raises the poor from the dirt,
and lifts up the needy from the garbage pile,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he might seat him with princes,
with the princes of his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes the barren woman of the family
a happy mother of children.
Praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Israel left Egypt,
when the family of Jacob left a foreign nation behind,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judah became his sanctuary,
Israel his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea looked and fled;
the Jordan River turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
the hills like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you flee, O sea?
Why do you turn back, O Jordan River?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you skip like rams, O mountains,
like lambs, O hills?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, O earth, before the Lord—
before the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who turned a rock into a pool of water,
a hard rock into springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us,
but to your name bring honor,
for the sake of your loyal love and faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should the nations say,
“Where is their God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our God is in heaven.
He does whatever he pleases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their idols are made of silver and gold—
they are man-made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
eyes, but cannot see,
speaker: Narrator

text:
ears, but cannot hear,
noses, but cannot smell,
speaker: Narrator

text:
hands, but cannot touch,
feet, but cannot walk.
They cannot even clear their throats.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make them will end up like them,
as will everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, trust in the Lord.
He is their deliverer and protector.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O family of Aaron, trust in the Lord.
He is their deliverer and protector.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You loyal followers of the Lord, trust in the Lord.
He is their deliverer and protector.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord takes notice of us; he will bless—
he will bless the family of Israel,
he will bless the family of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will bless his loyal followers,
both young and old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he increase your numbers,
yours and your children’s.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
the Creator of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens belong to the Lord,
but the earth he has given to mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
nor do any of those who descend into the silence of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But we will praise the Lord
now and forevermore.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love the Lord
because he heard my plea for mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and listened to me.
As long as I live, I will call to him when I need help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of death tightened around me,
the snares of Sheol confronted me.
I was confronted with trouble and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I called on the name of the Lord,
“Please, Lord, rescue my life!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is merciful and fair;
our God is compassionate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects the untrained;
I was in serious trouble and he delivered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rest once more, my soul,
for the Lord has vindicated you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, Lord, you rescued my life from death,
kept my eyes from tears
and my feet from stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will serve the Lord
in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I had faith when I said,
“I am severely oppressed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rashly declared,
“All men are liars.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can I repay the Lord
for all his acts of kindness to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will celebrate my deliverance,
and call on the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
before all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord values
the lives of his faithful followers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will present a thank offering to you,
and call on the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
before all his people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the courts of the Lord’s temple,
in your midst, O Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all you nations.
Applaud him, all you foreigners.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his loyal love towers over us,
and the Lord’s faithfulness endures.
Praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
and his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel say,
“Yes, his loyal love endures.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the family of Aaron say,
“Yes, his loyal love endures.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the loyal followers of the Lord say,
“Yes, his loyal love endures.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I cried out to the Lord.
The Lord answered me and put me in a wide open place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is on my side; I am not afraid.
What can people do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is on my side as my helper.
I look in triumph on those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take shelter in the Lord
than to trust in people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take shelter in the Lord
than to trust in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the nations surrounded me.
Indeed, in the name of the Lord I pushed them away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me.
Indeed, in the name of the Lord I pushed them away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me like bees.
But they disappeared as quickly as a fire among thorns.
Indeed, in the name of the Lord I pushed them away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You aggressively attacked me and tried to knock me down,
but the Lord helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives me strength and protects me;
he has become my deliverer.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They celebrate deliverance in the tents of the godly.
The Lord’s right hand conquers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s right hand gives victory;
the Lord’s right hand conquers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not die, but live,
and I will proclaim what the Lord has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord severely punished me,
but he did not hand me over to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open for me the gates of the just king’s temple.
I will enter through them and give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the Lord’s gate—
the godly enter through it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks, for you answered me,
and have become my deliverer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone that the builders discarded
has become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the Lord’s work.
We consider it amazing!
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day the Lord has brought about.
We will be happy and rejoice in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please, Lord, deliver!
Please, Lord, grant us success!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the one who comes in the name of the Lord be blessed.
We will pronounce blessings on you in the Lord’s temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is God, and he has delivered us.
Tie the offering with ropes
to the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I will give you thanks.
You are my God and I will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good
and his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those whose actions are blameless,
who obey the law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those who observe his rules,
and seek him with all their heart,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who, moreover, do no wrong,
but follow in his footsteps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You demand that your precepts
be carefully kept.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only I were predisposed
to keep your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I would not be ashamed,
if I were focused on all your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you sincere thanks,
when I learn your just regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep your statutes.
Do not completely abandon me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young person maintain a pure life?
By guarding it according to your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With all my heart I seek you.
Do not allow me to stray from your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my heart I store up your words,
so I might not sin against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You deserve praise, O Lord.
Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my lips I proclaim
all the regulations you have revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice in the lifestyle prescribed by your rules
as if they were riches of all kinds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on your precepts
and focus on your behavior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I find delight in your statutes;
I do not forget your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be kind to your servant.
Then I will live and keep your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open my eyes so I can truly see
the marvelous things in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a resident foreigner in this land.
Do not hide your commands from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I desperately long to know
your regulations at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You reprimand arrogant people.
Those who stray from your commands are doomed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Spare me shame and humiliation,
for I observe your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though rulers plot and slander me,
your servant meditates on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I find delight in your rules;
they give me guidance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I collapse in the dirt.
Revive me with your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I told you about my ways and you answered me.
Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me to understand what your precepts mean.
Then I can meditate on your marvelous teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I collapse from grief.
Sustain me by your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove me from the path of deceit.
Graciously give me your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I choose the path of faithfulness;
I am committed to your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hold fast to your rules.
O Lord, do not let me be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I run along the path of your commands,
for you enable me to do so.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me, O Lord, the lifestyle prescribed by your statutes,
so that I might observe it continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me understanding so that I might observe your law,
and keep it with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guide me in the path of your commands,
for I delight to walk in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me a desire for your rules,
rather than for wealth gained unjustly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my eyes away from what is worthless.
Revive me with your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Confirm to your servant your promise,
which you made to the one who honors you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away the insults that I dread.
Indeed, your regulations are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, I long for your precepts.
Revive me with your deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May I experience your loyal love, O Lord,
and your deliverance, as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will have a reply for the one who insults me,
for I trust in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not completely deprive me of a truthful testimony,
for I await your justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will keep your law continually
now and for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be secure,
for I seek your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will speak about your regulations before kings
and not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will find delight in your commands,
which I love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift my hands to your commands,
which I love,
and I will meditate on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your word to your servant,
for you have given me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what comforts me in my trouble,
for your promise revives me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people do nothing but scoff at me.
Yet I do not turn aside from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember your ancient regulations,
O Lord, and console myself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rage takes hold of me because of the wicked,
those who reject your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your statutes have been my songs
in the house where I live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember your name during the night, O Lord,
and I will keep your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This has been my practice,
for I observe your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my source of security.
I have determined to follow your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I seek your favor with all my heart.
Have mercy on me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I consider my actions
and follow your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I keep your commands eagerly
and without delay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of the wicked tighten around me,
but I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the middle of the night I arise to thank you
for your just regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a friend to all your loyal followers,
and to those who keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your loyal love fills the earth.
Teach me your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good to your servant,
O Lord, just as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me proper discernment and understanding.
For I consider your commands to be reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before I was afflicted I used to stray off,
but now I keep your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good and you do good.
Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people smear my reputation with lies,
but I observe your precepts with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their hearts are calloused,
but I find delight in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was good for me to suffer,
so that I might learn your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law you have revealed is more important to me
than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hands made me and formed me.
Give me understanding so that I might learn your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your loyal followers will be glad when they see me,
for I find hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know, Lord, that your regulations are just.
You disciplined me because of your faithful devotion to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May your loyal love console me,
as you promised your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May I experience your compassion, so I might live.
For I find delight in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the arrogant be humiliated, for they have slandered me.
But I meditate on your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May your loyal followers turn to me,
those who know your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May I be fully committed to your statutes,
so that I might not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I desperately long for your deliverance.
I find hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes grow tired as I wait for your promise to be fulfilled.
I say, “When will you comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am like a wineskin dried up in smoke.
I do not forget your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must your servant endure this?
When will you judge those who pursue me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant dig pits to trap me,
which violates your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your commands are reliable.
I am pursued without reason. Help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have almost destroyed me here on the earth,
but I do not reject your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Revive me with your loyal love,
that I might keep the rules you have revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your instructions endure;
they stand secure in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You demonstrate your faithfulness to all generations.
You established the earth and it stood firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Today they stand firm by your decrees,
for all things are your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I had not found encouragement in your law,
I would have died in my sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget your precepts,
for by them you have revived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I belong to you. Deliver me!
For I seek your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked prepare to kill me,
yet I concentrate on your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I realize that everything has its limits,
but your commands are beyond full comprehension.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O how I love your law!
All day long I meditate on it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
for I am always aware of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
for I meditate on your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am more discerning than those older than I,
for I observe your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I stay away from every evil path,
so that I might keep your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not turn aside from your regulations,
for you teach me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your words are sweeter
in my mouth than honey!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your precepts give me discernment.
Therefore I hate all deceitful actions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp to walk by,
and a light to illumine my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have vowed and solemnly sworn
to keep your just regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am suffering terribly.
O Lord, revive me with your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, please accept the freewill offerings of my praise.
Teach me your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life is in continual danger,
but I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked lay a trap for me,
but I do not wander from your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I claim your rules as my permanent possession,
for they give me joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am determined to obey your statutes
at all times, to the very end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate people with divided loyalties,
but I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place and my shield.
I find hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away from me, you evil men,
so that I can observe the commands of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sustain me as you promised, so that I will live.
Do not disappoint me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Support me, so that I will be delivered.
Then I will focus on your statutes continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You despise all who stray from your statutes,
for such people are deceptive and unreliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You remove all the wicked of the earth like slag.
Therefore I love your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My body trembles because I fear you;
I am afraid of your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do what is fair and right.
Do not abandon me to my oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guarantee the welfare of your servant.
Do not let the arrogant oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes grow tired as I wait for your deliverance,
for your reliable promise to be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show your servant your loyal love.
Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am your servant. Give me insight,
so that I can understand your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is time for the Lord to act—
they break your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this reason I love your commands
more than gold, even purest gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this reason I carefully follow all your precepts.
I hate all deceitful actions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your rules are marvelous.
Therefore I observe them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your instructions are a doorway through which light shines.
They give insight to the untrained.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I open my mouth and pant,
because I long for your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn toward me and extend mercy to me,
as you typically do to your loyal followers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Direct my steps by your word.
Do not let any sin dominate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from oppressive men,
so that I can keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smile on your servant.
Teach me your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tears stream down from my eyes,
because people do not keep your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are just, O Lord,
and your judgments are fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rules you impose are just,
and absolutely reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My zeal consumes me,
for my enemies forget your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is absolutely pure,
and your servant loves it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am insignificant and despised,
yet I do not forget your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your justice endures,
and your law is reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Distress and hardship confront me,
yet I find delight in your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your rules remain just.
Give me insight so that I can live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried out with all my heart, “Answer me, O Lord!
I will observe your statutes.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried out to you, “Deliver me,
so that I can keep your rules.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am up before dawn crying for help.
I find hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes anticipate the nighttime hours,
so that I can meditate on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me because of your loyal love.
O Lord, revive me, as you typically do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who are eager to do wrong draw near;
they are far from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are near, O Lord,
and all your commands are reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I learned long ago that
you ordained your rules to last.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See my pain and rescue me.
For I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fight for me and defend me.
Revive me with your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have no chance for deliverance,
for they do not seek your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your compassion is great, O Lord.
Revive me, as you typically do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The enemies who chase me are numerous.
Yet I do not turn aside from your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I take note of the treacherous and despise them,
because they do not keep your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how I love your precepts.
O Lord, revive me with your loyal love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your instructions are totally reliable;
all your just regulations endure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rulers pursue me for no reason,
yet I am more afraid of disobeying your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice in your instructions,
like one who finds much plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate and despise deceit;
I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seven times a day I praise you
because of your just regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who love your law are completely secure;
nothing causes them to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hope for your deliverance, O Lord,
and I obey your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I keep your rules;
I love them greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I keep your precepts and rules,
for you are aware of everything I do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my cry for help, O Lord.
Give me insight by your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my appeal for mercy.
Deliver me, as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May praise flow freely from my lips,
for you teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my tongue sing about your instructions,
for all your commands are just.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May your hand help me,
for I choose to obey your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long for your deliverance, O Lord;
I find delight in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May I live and praise you.
May your regulations help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have wandered off like a lost sheep.
Come looking for your servant,
for I do not forget your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I cried out
to the Lord and he answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “O Lord, rescue me
from those who lie with their lips
and those who deceive with their tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How will he severely punish you,
you deceptive talker?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here’s how! With the sharp arrows of warriors,
with arrowheads forged over the hot coals.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For too long I have had to reside
with those who hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am committed to peace,
but when I speak, they want to make war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look up toward the hills.
From where does my help come?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My help comes from the Lord,
the Creator of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he not allow your foot to slip.
May your Protector not sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look! Israel’s Protector
does not sleep or slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is your protector;
the Lord is the shade at your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will not harm you by day,
or the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will protect you from all harm;
he will protect your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will protect you in all you do,
now and forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was glad because they said to me,
“We will go to the Lord’s temple.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our feet are standing
inside your gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerusalem is a city designed
to accommodate an assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The tribes go up there,
the tribes of the Lord,
where it is required that Israel
give thanks to the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the leaders sit there on thrones and make legal decisions,
on the thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem.
May those who love her prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May there be peace inside your defenses,
and prosperity inside your fortresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of my brothers and my neighbors
I will say, “May there be peace in you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of the temple of the Lord our God
I will pray for you to prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look up toward you,
the one enthroned in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a female servant look to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes will look to the Lord, our God, until he shows us favor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show us favor, O Lord, show us favor!
For we have had our fill of humiliation, and then some.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have had our fill
of the taunts of the self-assured,
of the contempt of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If the Lord had not been on our side”—
let Israel say this.—
speaker: Narrator

text:
if the Lord had not been on our side,
when men attacked us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
they would have swallowed us alive,
when their anger raged against us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The water would have overpowered us;
the current would have overwhelmed us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The raging water
would have overwhelmed us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord deserves praise,
for he did not hand us over as prey to their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We escaped with our lives, like a bird from a hunter’s snare.
The snare broke, and we escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our deliverer is the Lord,
the Creator of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,
which cannot be moved and will endure forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
so the Lord surrounds his people,
now and forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the scepter of a wicked king will not settle
upon the allotted land of the godly.
Otherwise the godly
might do what is wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good, O Lord, to those who are good,
to the morally upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for those who are bent on traveling a sinful path,
may the Lord remove them, along with those who behave wickedly.
May Israel experience peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord restored the well-being of Zion,
we thought we were dreaming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At that time we laughed loudly
and shouted for joy.
At that time the nations said,
“The Lord has accomplished great things for these people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord did indeed accomplish great things for us.
We were happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, restore our well-being,
just as the streams in the arid south are replenished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who shed tears as they plant
will shout for joy when they reap the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who weeps as he walks along, carrying his bag of seed,
will certainly come in with a shout of joy, carrying his sheaves of grain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the Lord does not build a house,
then those who build it work in vain.
If the Lord does not guard a city,
then the watchman stands guard in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is vain for you to rise early, come home late,
and work so hard for your food.
Yes, he provides for those whom he loves even when they sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, sons are a gift from the Lord;
the fruit of the womb is a reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sons born during one’s youth
are like arrows in a warrior’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is the man who fills his quiver with them.
They will not be put to shame when they confront enemies at the city gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is every one of the Lord’s loyal followers,
each one who keeps his commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will eat what you worked so hard to grow.
You will be blessed and secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
in the inner rooms of your house;
your children will be like olive branches,
as they sit all around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes indeed, the man who fears the Lord
will be blessed in this way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord bless you from Zion,
that you might see Jerusalem prosper
all the days of your life,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and that you might see your grandchildren.
May Israel experience peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Since my youth they have often attacked me,”
let Israel say.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Since my youth they have often attacked me,
but they have not defeated me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The plowers plowed my back;
they made their furrows long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is just;
he cut the ropes of the wicked.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all who hate Zion
be humiliated and turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May they be like the grass on the rooftops,
which withers before one can even pull it up,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which cannot fill the reaper’s hand,
or the lap of the one who gathers the grain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who pass by will not say,
“May you experience the Lord’s blessing!
We pronounce a blessing on you in the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From the deep water I cry out to you, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, listen to me.
Pay attention to my plea for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you, O Lord, were to keep track of sins,
O Lord, who could stand before you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are willing to forgive,
so that you might be honored.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I yearn for the Lord,
more than watchmen do for the morning,
yes, more than watchmen do for the morning.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He will deliver Israel
from all their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, my heart is not proud,
nor do I have a haughty look.
I do not have great aspirations,
or concern myself with things that are beyond me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Israel, hope in the Lord
now and forevermore!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, for David’s sake remember
all his strenuous effort,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and how he made a vow to the Lord,
and swore an oath to the Powerful One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “I will not enter my own home,
or get into my bed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not allow my eyes to sleep,
or my eyelids to slumber,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I find a place for the Lord,
a fine dwelling place for the Powerful One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, we heard about it in Ephrathah;
we found it in the territory of Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us go to his dwelling place.
Let us worship before his footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascend, O Lord, to your resting place,
you and the ark of your strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May your priests be clothed with integrity.
May your loyal followers shout for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of David, your servant,
do not reject your chosen king.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
If your sons keep my covenant
and the rules I teach them,
their sons will also sit on your throne forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly the Lord has chosen Zion;
he decided to make it his home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “This will be my resting place forever;
I will live here, for I have chosen it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will abundantly supply what she needs;
I will give her poor all the food they need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will protect her priests,
and her godly people will shout exuberantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There I will make David strong;
I have determined that my chosen king’s dynasty will continue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will humiliate his enemies,
and his crown will shine.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look! How good and how pleasant it is
when brothers truly live in unity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like fine oil poured on the head,
which flows down the beard—
Aaron’s beard,
and then flows down his garments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like the dew of Hermon,
which flows down upon the hills of Zion.
Indeed, that is where the Lord has decreed
a blessing will be available—eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Attention! Praise the Lord,
all you servants of the Lord,
who serve in the Lord’s temple during the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift your hands toward the sanctuary
and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord, the Creator of heaven and earth,
bless you from Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the name of the Lord.
Offer praise, you servants of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who serve in the Lord’s temple,
in the courts of the temple of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good.
Sing praises to his name, for it is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,
Israel to be his special possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I know the Lord is great,
and our Lord is superior to all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does whatever he pleases
in heaven and on earth,
in the seas and all the ocean depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes the clouds to arise from the end of the earth,
makes lightning bolts accompany the rain,
and brings the wind out of his storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
including both men and animals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He performed awesome deeds and acts of judgment
in your midst, O Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He defeated many nations,
and killed mighty kings—
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
and Og, king of Bashan,
and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave their land as an inheritance,
as an inheritance to Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your name endures,
your reputation, O Lord, lasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord vindicates his people,
and has compassion on his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations’ idols are made of silver and gold;
they are man-made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
eyes, but cannot see,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and ears, but cannot hear.
Indeed, they cannot breathe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make them will end up like them,
as will everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O family of Israel, praise the Lord.
O family of Aaron, praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O family of Levi, praise the Lord.
You loyal followers of the Lord, praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord deserves praise in Zion—
he who dwells in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
for his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of gods,
for his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who performs magnificent, amazing deeds all by himself,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who used wisdom to make the heavens,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who spread out the earth over the water,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who made the great lights,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sun to rule by day,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the moon and stars to rule by night,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and led Israel out from their midst,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who divided the Red Sea in two,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and led Israel through its midst,
for his loyal love endures,
speaker: Narrator

text:
